0310/A0/04/001/004.status_value: The assessment showed that staff in 12 child policlinics in the capital out of 17 (70%) provide counselling for caregivers on child development  child cognitive stimulation and nutrition practices.
0310/A0/04/001/004.indicator_name: % of health facilities applying approved standards in MCH and nutrition services (including counselling caregivers on child development  knowledge of danger signs  child cognitive stimulation  nutrition practices) and using quality assurance mechanisms

0310/A0/04/001/004.status_value: Several discussions at the parliament related to the Law on mandatory industrial food fortificationfaced with resistance from parliamentarians and some government officials. As a further step for advocacy UNICEF is supporting Public Health and Reform Centre in elaboration of informational toolkit on aneamia reduction with special focus on advantages of flour fortification targeting decision makers. Further advocacacy with the Cabinet of Ministers to host and lead further discussions on food fort
0310/A0/04/001/004.indicator_name: % of mills applying flour fortification (FF) in accordance with new Law on mandatory industrial FF to be endorsed by 2012 and national standards on FF updated line with FFI/WHO recommendations.
0310/A0/04/001/004.baseline_value: 0% as no legislation on nutritional anaemia prevention through industrial FF existing

0310/A0/04/001/004.status_value: Completed. According to the findings of the National Nutrition Survey implemented in 2013  more than 75% of women receiving antenatal care went to their care provider more than four times.
0310/A0/04/001/004.indicator_name: % pregnant women from lowest quintile who have at least four pre-natal visits:
% pregnant women having at least four prenatal visits

0310/A0/04/001/006.status_value: The general public's knowledge and understanding of children's rights has enhanced through working with the media  organizing public events and high-level meetings. UNICEF Azerbaijan continued to be vocal in the national media and in-house media monitoring shows over 1000 UNICEF-related stories.  Regular contact with counterparts and the media resulted new partnership opportunities focusing media and public attention on child rights  with a major partnership with the Government of Azerbaijan  as
0310/A0/04/001/006.indicator_name: Number of public information initiativs undertaken by Government and/or civil society number of journalists following ethical guidelines on reporting with/for children.

0310/A0/04/001/006.status_value: Private sector partnership was initiated by establishing contacts and discussing ideas (as well submitting project proposals) ¿ that should result in new partnerships in 2016. CO plans to continue its work on advocacy around CRBP  specifically by conducting CSR legal mapping. Progress has not been achieved against the indicator #3 due to existing legislation gaps and some other factors (see bottlenecks). However  dialogue with private and government partners on this continues. A major private se
0310/A0/04/001/006.indicator_name: At least 4 government-corporate alliances that provide funding and social mobilization support to programmes for children

0310/A0/04/001/006.status_value: not achieved due to lack of funding to the program
0310/A0/04/001/006.indicator_name: At least 7 companies with child rights as part of their CSR in the country and with number of child rights focused

0310/A0/04/001/006.status_value: on track - with UNICEF support the syllabus for child rights training for media professionals has been adapted and introduced as part of journalism degree courses in 3 universities  thus presenting a major step towards fundamental change on the reporting of children at the academic level  as well as a sustainable approach to the education of journalists.
0310/A0/04/001/006.indicator_name: At By 2012  at least 3 universities that adapt child rights syllabus as part of its curriculum and by 2015 prepare cadre of students' trained using newly developed syllabus.

0310/A0/04/001/001.status_value: National education strategy contains principles of CFS  which will ensure nationwide implementation of CFS. MOE has began implementation of inclusive education for children with disabilities.
0310/A0/04/001/001.indicator_name: Annual Percentage growth in number of CFS certified schools

Mapping/study on needs for services for the country is conducted and the local governments and line ministries are considering this in its policies
Availability of government funding to services and programs that address child protection issues.

0310/A0/04/001/002.status_value: Achieved. The Government has changed the policy and has been funding the services for vulnerable children through national level agencies  where participation of local governments were minimal. Starting 2013  the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection has been funding NGO-run programmes that target most vulnerable children living in 14 districts (rural and urban).
0310/A0/04/001/002.indicator_name: # of local authorities that provide a minimum* package of child care services to the most vulnerable children (children from dysfunctional families  those deprived of parental care as well as children from poor families and remote areas)

0310/A0/04/001/002.status_value: Achieved. The Government has changed the policy and has been funding the services for vulnerable children through national level agencies  where participation of local governments were minimal. Starting 2013  the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection has been supporting NGO-run and its own progammes targeting children with disabilities in 11 districts.
0310/A0/04/001/002.indicator_name: Number of local authorities in 6 pilot districts addressing the issue of integration and inclusion of children with disabilities through community support services

0310/A0/04/001/002.status_value: In 14 districts  the local authorities have been working closely with the national agencies and specialised NGOs to implement mechanisms and standards that adhere to international principles.
0310/A0/04/001/002.indicator_name: Number of local authorities which are implementing child care mechanisms that conform to international standards.

0310/A0/04/001/002.status_value: Social work has been integrated into the legislation as a concept and all professionals in the pilot districts have been trained and started using child care practices.
0310/A0/04/001/002.indicator_name: % of child care professionals who apply comprehensive social work and child care practices when responding to the needs of vulnerable children  including CWD in pilot districts

Law on Juvenile Justice is not approved

0310/A0/04/001/003.status_value: Achieved. Legal aid  legal representation services are available in 7 districts  diversion and psycho-social programmes available in 2 districts  legal aid services available in two ASAN Public Services Centres.
0310/A0/04/001/003.indicator_name: % of districts supporting a comprehensive* and fully functional system for J4C.

0310/A0/04/001/003.status_value: Two specialised justice teams  consisting of 6 judges and two prosecutor officers administering justice for juveniles in accordance with the national and international law.
0310/A0/04/001/003.indicator_name: % of justice and law enforcement professionals administering justices decisions for children in accordance with the legislative framework for J4C

% of targeted government agencies and CSOs that promote positive and measurable behaviour and social outcomes in child survival  protection growth and development in 20 districts of Azerbaijan

0310/A0/04/002/003.status_value: 50% of parents  young people and religious leaders acquired knowledge and positive attitudes to eliminate child marriages in selected communities of 4 southern districts while 30% young people gained positive attitudes and practices to address child marriages  healthy life style  HIV and AIDS at 6 districts. Number of adolescents and young people who adopted and sustain key behavioural practices on healthy life style and HIV/AIDS prevention increased from 0 to 546.
0310/A0/04/002/003.indicator_name: % family and communities in (rural  poorest area) with positive attitudes and practices for child survival  protection  growth and development.

0310/A0/04/002/002.status_value: More than 10 initiatives pertinent to child rights monitoring has been successfully undertaken by the Human Rights Commissioner of Azerbaijan  such as ratification of the UN CRPD  draft laws on elimination of corporal punishment  torture  ill treatment  rights of persons with disabilities  etc.
0310/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: # of initiatives addressing children's issues raised by the high level official elected by the parliament and responsible for the independent child rights monitoring

0310/A0/04/002/001.status_value: Achieved. A internal government monitoring and coordination mechanism has been established in 2012 by the Presidential decree  which compiles and reports child rights promotion and CRC implementation annually.
0310/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: # of recommendations on the cross-sectorial issues raised by the CRC coordination body to the state authorities

0310/A0/04/002/001.status_value: A number of changes have been made to the legislation (family code  penal code  etc) following to the CRC Concluding Observations.
0310/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: # of proposals put forward by state bodies on the improvement of legislation on children.
